diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Calculus of gallbladder with other cholecystitis, without mention of obstruction
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The MRCP findings indicated the presence of gallstones in the gallbladder, with pericholecystic edema and gallbladder wall enhancement, which are suggestive of cholecystitis. The absence of any obstruction indicated by a nondilated common bile duct further supported this diagnosis.
